moves.1. e4: Here is yet another of the games from freddy's tourney.  I'm breaking my trend and annotating a game where I win.
moves.1... c5 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: I like e6 for Black as so far, it has afforded my quickest development.
moves.10. g3: This move by White takes us right out of the database.  We're on our own from here on out.
moves.12. Ncxe4 Qe7: I'd be happy to trade my B for a N.  I hate the White N's in this opening.
moves.13. Nxe6 Nf6: We'll be trading off a piece...please let me have the N.
moves.15. Bxe4+ Kb6 16. Bd5: With his N pinned, my dream was to trade off my R for the N and B, thereby taking White's two developed pieces.
moves.16... Qf6 17. c3: I think here Black was concerned about pressure on b2.  As noted, that was not what I was after.
moves.20. d4 cxd4 21. cxd4 Bb4: Here is where I wonder if I made an error.  I have been told that I'm a bit too aggressive and in this opening, patience is preached.  Would developing my R have been the smarter way to go?
moves.22. a3 Be1: I thought here that I could inhibit White's Bishop, but again, my R sits idly by.
moves.23. f5 Qe2: I'm kind of committed now as I have to guard the Bishop.  At this point, I was kicking myself for not developing my Rook.
moves.24. Bf4 Bd2: I'm hoping to trade Bishops.  I had actually put in conditional moves as I thought White might play 25. Bd4  Rc8  26. Bc5+  Rxc5  27. exc5  Kxc5  And we'd be left with Q and B vs two Rooks.
moves.25. Bxd2 Qxd2: At this point, my opponent wrote to me:  "I think I've just about given away any advantage I may have had earlier. Your material superiority and active Queen should give you an easy win now. Well played."  I wonder if he was using psychology on me as once I heard I should have an easy win, I immediately became nervous.  I encouraged him to play on as I have lost games with better advantage and he cheerfully agreed to do so.
moves.26. Rad1 Qe3+ 27. Kg2 Qe4+:
It was around here that I wrote myself a note:

Keys to the win: 1. Q does not get on same file/rank as K 2. Look to trade off Rook 3. Slowly pick off his pawns  

I figured if I could do this, I should be able to win.
moves.37. Rg6+ Kc7 38. Rh6 Qxa3+ 39. Kg4 b5 40: I did the math and exchanging Q for R was winning for Black.
moves.43... Qxh3+ 44. Kxh3 b4 45. Kg3 b3: And now we just play the game out to checkmate.  An enjoyable game and I look forward to my next one against rjacobs.

gameName: The Annotation Project - Played To The End
